tt <- function(x) {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
    sprintf("\\texttt{%s}", as.character(x))
  } else if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
    sprintf("<tt>%s</tt>", as.character(x))
  } else {
    x
  }
}

# Setup

## Libraries

library(httr)
library(xml2)

## Retrieve Data from `r tt("AoC")`


```{r get-data, cache = FALSE, messages = FALSE}
session_cookie <- set_cookies(session = keyring::key_get("AoC-GitHub-Cookie"))
base_url <- paste0("https://adventofcode.com/", params$year, "/day/", params$task_nr)
puzzle <- GET(base_url,
              session_cookie) %>% 
  content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
  xml_find_all("///article") %>% 
  lapply(as.character)

parse_puzzle_data <- function(text_block = readClipboard()) {
  if (length(text_block) == 1L) {
    text_block <- text_block %>% 
      str_split("\n") %>% 
      extract2(1L) %>% 
      keep(nzchar)
  }
  text_block
}

puzzle_data <- local({
  GET(paste0(base_url, "/input"),
      session_cookie) %>% 
    content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
    parse_puzzle_data()
})
```

# Puzzle Day `r params$task_nr`

## Part 1

### Description

```{r show-puzzle-a, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
cat(puzzle[[1]])
```

### Solution

We write a parser, which first remove `!.` sequences, then removes garbage sequences and
finally parses the groups. This is done by replacing each `{x}` by `list(x)`. The we need 
toparse the string and evaluate it. This will give us a nested list. The we recurse 
through this list and whenever we encounter a pure `list()` element we return the depth 
increased by 1. We also add the increased depth at the Ã¼arent to count this element and 
eventually we sum up the values to get the final score.

```{r get-solution-1}
parse_stream <- function(stream = puzzle_data) {
  cleaned_stream <- stream %>% 
    str_remove_all("!.") %>% 
    str_remove_all("<[^>]*>") %>% 
    str_replace_all(",{2,}", ",") %>% 
    str_replace_all(",\\}", "}") %>% 
    str_replace_all("\\{,", "{")
  parsed_stream <- cleaned_stream
  while (str_detect(parsed_stream, "\\{")) {
    parsed_stream <- str_replace_all(parsed_stream, "\\{([^{]*)\\}", "list(\\1)")
  }
  lists <- parse(text = parsed_stream) %>% 
    eval()
  count_groups <- function(l, list_index) {
    if (identical(l, list())) {
      result <- list_index + 1L
    } else {
      result <- map(l, count_groups, list_index + 1) %>% 
        c(list_index + 1L) %>% 
        unlist() %>% 
        sum()
    }
    result
  }
  count_groups(lists, 0L)
} 
parse_stream(puzzle_data)
```

## Part 2

### Description

```{r show-puzzle-b, echo = FALSE, results = "asis", eval = length(puzzle) > 1}
cat(puzzle[[2]])
```

### Solution

We solve this with some regex. First we remove all canceled characters, then extract all 
garbage groups, remove the the garbage delimiters and fnally count the characters.

```{r get-solution-2}
count_garbage <- function(stream) {
  stream %>% 
    str_remove_all("!.") %>% 
    str_extract_all("<[^>]*>") %>% 
    extract2(1L) %>% 
    str_remove_all("^<|>$") %>% 
    nchar() %>% 
    sum()
}
count_garbage(puzzle_data)
```
